WASGHINTON- An agreement
was reached in the nation S CAPT.
tai by the Washington Hotel Assn,
and the Washington Urban League
for more Negroes to be hired and
promoted in positions other than
maids and porters.


Major hotels now only employ
nonwhites in unskilled categor-
les. The Urban League stresses
hiring them as cashiers, clerks
and switchboard operators.

CAMBRIDGE, Md. National
Guard troops withdrew from this
racial trouble spot, a year after
the violence summoned them.

Teamwork has been the accomplishment
of these employees of Gulf Oil Corporation National Broadcasng
Company and Young Rubcam, Inc They
geer provide information media both
political and election night exclusively
sored on NBC-TV and radio by Gulf.


Left right first Lois Weissfog Gulf Roy Koher,
Gulf Harry Rauch R; Betty Marshall NBC; Pete Fischer,
r. Paul Gardner, 3 R. Back row; Gulf James

A year ago, 400 guardsmen
were rushed to the community
by Gov. ]. Willard Tawes after
a night of racial rioting in which
six pers ons we're shot.

cises Rev. ]. o. Mundy and staff

WeII-pIanned outdoor lighting gives
you extra hours to enjoy outdoor living
. lets you entertain on the patio,
enjoy family games and friendly get
togethers outside after dark. Friends
will feel more welcome, too, with good
lighting on driveways, walks and steps.
Attractive lighting enhances the natural
beauty Of trees, shrubs, flowers, toun-
tains and distinctive architecture. On
the practical side, it enables you to work
on the grounds in the cool Of the eve
ming .. helps prevent accidents, too
and increases security.


Outdoor lighting does SO much, yet
costs so little. Call Arizona Public
Service Company for Certified Light
ing ConsuItant to come out and give
you the latest suggestions for improv-
ing your home with outdoor lighting.
There's no obligation, of course.

full articles.headline:
HOTEL WORKERS


TO BE PROMOTED
full articles.article:
WASGHINTON- An agreement
was reached in the nation S CAPT.
tai by the Washington Hotel Assn,
and the Washington Urban League
for more Negroes to be hired and
promoted in positions other than
maids and porters.


Major hotels now only employ
nonwhites in unskilled categor-
les. The Urban League stresses
hiring them as cashiers, clerks
and switchboard operators.

the violence summoned them.
